meanings.definition: Pretended or exaggerated illness or incapacity in order to avoid duty or work.
meanings.sent1: The soldier's malingered sickness kept him away from the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: Her constant malingered ailments made her coworkers suspicious.
meanings.sent3: The student's malingered headache miraculously disappeared when the teacher announced a surprise quiz.
meanings.sent4: His malingered back pain vanished as soon as the weekend approached.
meanings.sent5: The cat's malingered limp miraculously healed when it saw a mouse.

meanings.definition: To pretend to be ill or incapacitated in order to avoid work or duty.
meanings.sent1: He malingered a cough to skip school.
meanings.sent2: She often malingered to get out of doing chores.
meanings.sent3: The employee malingered a sore throat to avoid the boring meeting.
meanings.sent4: The child malingered a stomach ache to avoid eating vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The student malingered a twisted ankle to skip gym class.
